front.title: Signaled PID When Multiplexing Multiple Payloads over RSVP-TE LSPs

abstract.t: There are many deployment scenarios where an RSVP-TE LSP carries multiple payloads. In these cases, it gets ambiguous on what should value should be carried as L3PID in the Label Request Object [RFC3209] or G-PID in the Generalized Label Request Object Expires January 2009 [page 1] draft-ali-mpls-sig-pid-multiplexing-case-00.txt [RFC3471], [RFC3473]. The document propose use of some dedicated PID values to cover some typical cases of multiple payload carried by the LSP, including that indicates to the egress node to ignore signaling to learn payload carried by the LSP.
